description:
To Nonresidential Consumers taking service for electric vehicle charging stations separately
metered from other electric service whose loads have not registered 1,000 kW or more, more
than once in the preceding 18-month period and who are not otherwise subject to service on
Schedules 47 or 48. Consumer charging sites must be broadly available to the general public
and must include at least one direct current (DC) fast charger as defined in the special conditions
below. Deliveries at more than one point, or more than one voltage and phase classification, will
be separately metered and billed. Participation in this schedule and Schedule 745 will be limited
to a combined 200 metered points of delivery on a first-come, first served basis.
energycomments:
Rate = Distribution charge + Transmission and Ancillary Services charge + System Usage charge + 201 Net Power Costs+ 200 Base Supply Service|| 
Adjustment = 80 Generation Investment Adjustment + 90 Summary of Effective Rate Adjustments +91 Low Income Bill Payment Assistance Fund +
95 Pilot Program Cost Adjustment + 98 Adjustment Associated with the Pacific Northwest Electric Power Planning and Conservation Act +
+ 192 Deferred Accounting Adjustment + 196 Adjustment to Remove Deer Creek Mine Investment From Rate Base + 197 Deer Creek Mine Undepreciated Investment Adjustment
199 Klamath Dam Removal Surcharges + 203 Renewable Resource Deferral - Supply Service Adjustment+
204 Oregon Solar Incentive Program Deferral - Supply Service Adjustment + 205 TAM Adjustment for Other Revenues +
206 Power Cost Adjustment Mechanism - Adjustment + 297 Energy Conservation Charge + 299 Rate Mitigation Adjustment
||All charges to customer are increased according to rider 290 Public Purpose Charge by (3%)||
All other riders not listed are either zero at time of update or have characteristics the URDB is incapable of capturing.

name: Schedule 745 - Public DC fast charger optional Transitional rate - Primary(101kW - 300kW)
